Reshape CI between wide/long formats

Source: R/reshape_ci.R
reshape_ci.Rd

Reshape CI between wide/long formats.

reshape_ci(x)

Arguments

x

A data.frame containing CI_low and CI_high.

Examples

library(bayestestR)

x <- data.frame(replicate(4, rnorm(100)))
x <- ci(x, ci = c(0.68, 0.89, 0.95))
reshape_ci(x)
#>   Parameter  CI_low_68 CI_high_68 CI_low_89 CI_high_89 CI_low_95 CI_high_95
#> 1        X1 -0.7614217  1.1019476 -1.660733   1.806208 -2.276762   2.062146
#> 2        X2 -1.2617900  0.6977671 -1.874115   1.452030 -2.207716   1.803204
#> 3        X3 -0.9681830  1.2069143 -1.372021   1.736897 -1.650723   2.338356
#> 4        X4 -0.8250735  1.0748263 -1.373158   1.589476 -1.911417   2.225946
reshape_ci(reshape_ci(x))
#>    Parameter CI     CI_low   CI_high
#> 1         X1 68 -0.7614217 1.1019476
#> 2         X1 89 -1.6607327 1.8062081
#> 3         X1 95 -2.2767624 2.0621457
#> 4         X2 68 -1.2617900 0.6977671
#> 5         X2 89 -1.8741148 1.4520299
#> 6         X2 95 -2.2077164 1.8032044
#> 7         X3 68 -0.9681830 1.2069143
#> 8         X3 89 -1.3720210 1.7368972
#> 9         X3 95 -1.6507230 2.3383555
#> 10        X4 68 -0.8250735 1.0748263
#> 11        X4 89 -1.3731582 1.5894755
#> 12        X4 95 -1.9114166 2.2259464

x <- data.frame(replicate(4, rnorm(100)))
x <- describe_posterior(x, ci = c(0.68, 0.89, 0.95))
reshape_ci(x)
#>   Parameter      Median CI_low_95 CI_high_95  CI_low_68 CI_high_68 CI_low_89
#> 1        X1 -0.08922384 -2.135655   1.678506 -1.0179664  0.6203379 -1.651129
#> 2        X2  0.01676218 -2.343277   1.568950 -1.0107161  1.0385287 -1.350123
#> 3        X3 -0.09289606 -2.241567   2.014335 -0.8698821  0.9936525 -1.613026
#> 4        X4 -0.06963768 -1.618110   2.685636 -1.1553163  0.4298439 -1.422590
#>   CI_high_89   pd ROPE_CI ROPE_low ROPE_high ROPE_Percentage
#> 1   1.264490 0.53      89     -0.1       0.1      0.08888889
#> 2   1.703746 0.50      89     -0.1       0.1      0.04444444
#> 3   1.515361 0.56      89     -0.1       0.1      0.10000000
#> 4   1.531260 0.55      89     -0.1       0.1      0.12222222
reshape_ci(reshape_ci(x))
#>    Parameter      Median CI     CI_low   CI_high   pd ROPE_CI ROPE_low
#> 1         X1 -0.08922384 68 -1.0179664 0.6203379 0.53      89     -0.1
#> 2         X1 -0.08922384 89 -1.6511285 1.2644896 0.53      89     -0.1
#> 3         X1 -0.08922384 95 -2.1356547 1.6785061 0.53      89     -0.1
#> 4         X2  0.01676218 68 -1.0107161 1.0385287 0.50      89     -0.1
#> 5         X2  0.01676218 89 -1.3501229 1.7037461 0.50      89     -0.1
#> 6         X2  0.01676218 95 -2.3432774 1.5689503 0.50      89     -0.1
#> 7         X3 -0.09289606 68 -0.8698821 0.9936525 0.56      89     -0.1
#> 8         X3 -0.09289606 89 -1.6130263 1.5153608 0.56      89     -0.1
#> 9         X3 -0.09289606 95 -2.2415675 2.0143345 0.56      89     -0.1
#> 10        X4 -0.06963768 68 -1.1553163 0.4298439 0.55      89     -0.1
#> 11        X4 -0.06963768 89 -1.4225899 1.5312605 0.55      89     -0.1
#> 12        X4 -0.06963768 95 -1.6181096 2.6856358 0.55      89     -0.1
#>    ROPE_high ROPE_Percentage
#> 1        0.1      0.08888889
#> 2        0.1      0.08888889
#> 3        0.1      0.08888889
#> 4        0.1      0.04444444
#> 5        0.1      0.04444444
#> 6        0.1      0.04444444
#> 7        0.1      0.10000000
#> 8        0.1      0.10000000
#> 9        0.1      0.10000000
#> 10       0.1      0.12222222
#> 11       0.1      0.12222222
#> 12       0.1      0.12222222
